newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: BHP shares dive after Foster's selloff.
newsitem.headline: BHP shares dive after Foster's selloff.

text.p: Shares in The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd dived 15 cents to A$18.90 after Foster's Brewing Group announced a capital restructuring that would see BHP's shareholding in Foster's dispersed to institutional and retail investors.
Prior to the announcment, BHP shares stood at A$19.05.

Foster's said its 36.5 percent shareholder Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd would place 86 percent of its 716.6 million Foster's shareholding to institutions at A$2.49 per share with the other 100 million shares offered to BHP shareholders.
BHP said it would recognise a book gain on the sale of its 616 million shares of about A$75 million.

The second part of the restructuring would see Foster's buy back 254.5 million of its shares from Asahi Breweries for A$625 million, paying A$2.49 per share, which represents the bulk of Asahi's 270.3 million shareholding.
Brokers said the announcement had taken some of the shine off BHP on the day, despite much of the news being well flagged.
"It was a bit surprising and I'm not sure what makes it quite so negative," said a Sydney-based dealer, noting that the A$2.49 price appeared to be reasonable, given the size of the stakes involved.
"I don't think anyone would have been kidding themselves they were going to get a lot higher than that."
BHP shares ended 14 cents lower at A$18.83 on turnover of 3.5 million shares, while Foster's shares remained under a trading halt after the announcement.
Prior to the announcement Foster's shares were three cents lower at A$2.60 on turnover of 1.01 million shares.
